text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Pupils attending Koran classes given by extremist religious groups are made to vow to fight until an Islamist state is founded.
- Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan insists on not signing a National Security Council statement against the rising Islamist movement.
- Three biggest unions announce their full support for military push against government.
- Erbakan says the National Security Council cannot give orders to government.
- Police prevent bid to smuggle 250 priceless historical pieces out of country.
- Hunger strike to protest prison conditions is on its 27th day in Aydin prison, southwest Turkey.
- Inflation is high and markets are shaky amid political chaos.
- Directorate of religious affairs investigates whether it is in keeping with Islam to clone living beings.
